law.catch_line: The Authority consists of the following nine members:...

text.section:
The Authority consists of the following nine members:
seven members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate;
one member appointed by the President of the Senate; and
one member appointed by the Speaker of the House.

section.section: The Governor shall consider the geographic diversity of the State when appointing members.

text.section:
The members appointed by the President and the Speaker:
may not be elected officials; and
shall have experience and expertise in venture capital investments.
Each member shall be a resident of the State.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed.
A member appointed by the Governor may be removed by the Governor with or without cause.
The terms of the members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Authority on July 1, 2011.

text.section: A member of the Authority may not have any financial interest in a purchaser, qualified business, or venture firm.
